title: [Suggestion/Question] VSF Support?
body: Heya! I'm wondering if the VSF format would ever be considered in the future due to the enhanced capability for shaders and such. The lack of external shaders in VRM is pretty restrictive for some models/projects, so having the ability to use more would be rather nice.

title: Hot reload for model picker buttons
body: Uses FileSystemWatcher to listen for changes on the VRM folder and regenerates the buttons. There is a 3 second delay before the buttons are generated to make sure all the files are added. In my case, the delay was enough for even 128 VRM files added at the same time.

Did you use the auto T-Pose thing while exporting as a VRM1? I think that's what causes the model to go miles off the camera.

title: Use buttons to swap character models
body:
This PR implements functionality to select a VRM via buttons in the in-game character selection menu instead of having to press F4. Upon first launch, a `VRM` folder is generated in the root game folder. The user must place all of their desired .vrm files into this folder. Each time the program is launched, the mod will scan through this folder and assign a button to each discovered vrm file. Navigating to the character selection menu and clicking on a button will load the respective custom model.

The F4 functionality has been replaced as a hotkey to quickly open the character selection menu, as suggested by @morphicschris. Other ideas tossed around were an importer to auto-import .vrms into the VRM folder, or keeping functionality of both. I am open to ideas on this topic.

comments.body: things seem pretty self explanatory. I think we can start our work based on this. I approve

title: Lighting / Shadow Engine Mishaps
body:
Been noticing a few PMX files have their shadow engines break when importing (post conversion). These files lose all shadow for clothes except in a few places (shoes, eyes, possibly some tops). With the loading of the custom VRMs being possible is the possibility of **disabling shadows** something we can tap into with the unity engine?

Honestly the shadows look tacky too... but unsure if the loader could do this at all. Cheers
author: fuwamocoanon

comments.body: Yep! This is one of the things I also want to add to CustomAvatarLoader! We will tackle into this once we start working on a UI. For now, I'm closing the issue, will mention this issue when making the pull request! (if I don't forget)

title: Dependency injection to move VRM loader to a service and prepare for future work
author: morphicschris

comments.body: @hrolfurgylfa @YusufOzmen01 Ready for review and merge

Can we find some other way to have the DLLs other than checking them into source control? I really hate seeing DLLs there as you can't quickly read over them to see exactly what they do. Anyone could easily just slide malware in there in a future update and no-one would notice.

Was Nuget not an option? Or even just having instructions in the README on where to download the DLLs and where to place them, I think that would still be better than checking them into source control.

yeah I agree with @hrolfurgylfa. if we can keep DLLs out of source code, that'd be great. I'll merge it when we are sure that we just can't get it working without having DLLs in the source code or solve the issue that doesn't allow us to not have DLLs in the source code
Yep, LGTM! @morphicschris I'm merging it if everything is okay
Let's do this \o/

title: Move file dialog to async Task
body:
This avoids the character window freezing when opening the file dialog by running the file dialog in a background thread.

This also keeps the same name for the new ShowChooseModelWindow function the same as #32 to avoid unnecessary merge conflicts, but there will be a slight conflict as I needed to make that function async.

title: Area around character is un-clickable after pressing F4
body:
Anything behind the character is un-clickable when you have the file dialog open, including the file dialog itself.

This seems to be because the window takes all the clicks inside it and is always on top, but when running it lets clicks through if they didn't hit the character, however, the file dialog freezes the window, so it can no longer check if clicks hit the character or not and thus no click passes through.

The two solutions I see for this is either making the window dialog open up on a background thread, not sure if this is possible, I've had some problems with C# Task objects and Il2Cpp in the past, or temporarily making the window no longer always stay on top, or just hiding it completely while the file dialog is open.
author: hrolfurgylfa

comments.body: I suppose we can minimize the window and then show the file dialog, that would be the best approach here

I managed to get this working with C# Task and async/await, so the model can keep animating while the file menu is open, and you can click past the model, and even interact with the model while the file dialog is open.

I'm just cleaning up the code, will have a PR up in a moment.
Fixed in PR #40

title: Allow specifying a custom game path with environment variables
body: This allows setting the GamePath environment variable before running `dotnet build` if you don't have the game installed on your C drive. It shouldn't impact the previous behaviour as the path on the C drive is used if the GamePath environment variable isn't set.
